gurmukhi: Aaur khw ju pY AYsI sBw hU mY jUJb miRq hI hY injkwnI ]qau Ary byd purwnn mY cil hY jg mY jug cwr khwnI ]2339]
transliteration: Aur Kahaa Ju Pai Aisisabhaa Hoo Mai Joojhab Mrit Hihai Nijkaanee|| Taudare Bed Puraanan Mai Chal(i) Hai Jag Mai Juh Chaar Kahaanee||2339||
translation: It appears that your death has come very near in the court; this story will also continue to be told in all the four ages in Vedas and Puranas.2339.

gurmukhi: kw BXo jo cmkwie kY ckiH AYsy khXo quih mwir frogo ]gUjr qo qy hau CqRI khwie kY AYsI sBw hUM ky bIc trogo ]
transliteration: Kaa Bhayo Jo Chamkaae Kai Chakrah(i) Aise Kahyo Tuhe Daar(i) Darogol Goojar To Te Hau Chhatrikahaae Kai Aisisabhaa Hoon Ke Beech Darogo||
translation: “Glistening your discus, you are threatening to kill me, shall I became afraid by this? Being called a Kshatriya, shall I become afraid in this court from a Gujjar like you?

gurmukhi: mwq su BRwq Aru qwq kI sauh ry quih mirhO nih Awp mrogo ]kRoD rukMmn ko Dr kY hir qo sMg Awj indwn krogo ]2340]
transliteration: Maat Su Bhraat Ar(u) Taat Kisauh Re Tuhe Marihau Nah(i) Aap Darogo|| Krodh Roukanman Ko Dhar Kai Har(i) To San Aaj Naidaan Darogo||2340||
translation: “I swear by my parents and brother I shall not die today, but shall kill you and I shall today avenge you on account of Rukmi.”2340.

gurmukhi: kop pRcMf kIXo qb sXwm jb ey bqIXw isspwlih BwKI ]kwnH khXo jV cwhq miRq kI XO sB login sUrj swKI ]
transliteration: Kop Prachanndd Keeyo Tab Syaam Jab E Bateeyaa Sispaalah(i) Bhaakhee|| Kaahn Kahyo Jad Chaahat Mrit Kiyau Sabh Logad(i) Sooraj Saakhee||
translation: When Shishupal said this, then Krishna became greatly enraged and said, “O fool! this whole court and the sun are a witness that you want death,

gurmukhi: ckR sudrSn lY kr BIqr kUd sBw sB hI soaU nwKI ]Dwvq BXo kib sXwm khY su BXo iqh ky bD ko AiBlwKI ]2341]
transliteration: Chakra Sudarshan Lai Kar Bheetar Kood Sabhaa Sabb Hisooo Naakhdee|| Dhaavat Bhyo Kabi Syaam Su Bhayo Tih Ke Badh Ko Abhiklaakhee||2341||
translation: “Krishna took the discus in his hand and jumped and advanced forward in order to kill Shishupal.2341.

gurmukhi: Dwvq BXo biRjnwiek jU ieq qy auq qy soaU swmuih AwXo ]ros bFwie Gno icq mY qik kY iqh S`qR ko c`kR clwXo ]
transliteration: Dhaavat Bhyo Brijnaaik Joo It Te Out Te Sooo Te Sooo Saamuh(i) Aayo|| Ros Badhaae Ghano Chit Mai Tak(i) Kai Tih Shattra Ko Chakkra Chalaayo||
translation: On this side Krishna advanced forward and from that side Shishupal came in front of him; getting extremely angry, Krishna discharged his discus towards the enemy;

gurmukhi: jwie lgXo iqh kMT ibKY kit dyq BXo Cut BU pr AwXo ]ieau aupmw aupjI jIA mY idv qy riv kO mwno mwr igrwXo ]2342]
transliteration: Jaae Lahyo Tih Kanth Bikhai Kattee Det Bhayo Chhodht Bhoo Par Aayo|| Io Oupmaa Oupjjijeea Mai Div Te Rav(i) Kau Maano Maar Giraayo||2342||
translation: The discus hit the throat of Shishupal, his head was chopped and it fell on the ground like the sun being killed had been thrown on the earth.2342.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry isspwl bDih iDAwie ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Sispaal Badhah(i) Dhiaae||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Shishupal” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ kwnH jU kop rwjw XuiDStr iCmwpn krq Bey ]
transliteration: Ath Kaadh Joo Kop Raaja Yudhishtar Chhimmaapan Karat Bhae||
translation: Now begins the description of Krishna getting infuriated and Yudhistar asking for forgiveness.

gurmukhi: kwt kY sIs dXo isspwl ko kop BrXo doaU nYn ncwvY ]kaunu blI ieh bIc sBwhU ko hY hm so soaU ju`Du mcwvY ]
transliteration: Kaat Kai Sees Dayo Sispaal Ko Kop Bdaryo Dooo Nain Nachaavai|| Kaoun(u) Balieh Beech Sabhaahoo Ko Hai Ham So Sooo Juddh(u) Machaavai||
translation: After chopping the head of Shishupal, and getting enraged, Krishna made his eyes dance and said, “Is there anyone so mighty, who can fight with me;”

gurmukhi: pwrQ BIm qy Awidk bIr rhy cup hoie Aiq hI fr AwvY ]suMdr AYsy srUp ky aUpir sXwm kbIsr pY bil jwvY ]2343]
transliteration: Paarath Bheem Te Aadik Beer Rahe Choup Hoe At(i) Hidar Aavai|| Soundar Aise Saroop Ke Oopar(i) Syaam Kabeesar Pai Bal(i) Jaavai||2343||
translation: The heroes like Arjuna and Bhima, sat silently with fear; the poet Shyam says that the poets are a sacrifice to his most charming figure.2343.
